meanings.definition: Relating to or situated on the edge or periphery.
meanings.sent1: The peripherally located house had a beautiful view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The peripherally placed decorations added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The peripherally positioned chair seemed to be hiding from the rest of the furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her peripherally standing position in the group photo made her easy to spot.
meanings.sent5: The peripherally positioned lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: In a secondary or minor role or position.
meanings.sent1: The peripherally involved character played a small part in the story.
meanings.sent2: She felt peripherally important in the large company meeting.
meanings.sent3: The peripherally mentioned detail turned out to be crucial to the investigation.
meanings.sent4: His peripherally recognized talent finally got the recognition it deserved.
meanings.sent5: The peripherally placed sign was easily overlooked by most visitors.

meanings.definition: In a way that is only slightly connected or related to something.
meanings.sent1: She smiled peripherally at the joke she overheard.
meanings.sent2: The information was peripherally relevant to the main topic of discussion.
meanings.sent3: He peripherally glanced at the clock, realizing he was running late.
meanings.sent4: The music played peripherally in the background as they chatted.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread wafted peripherally from the bakery down the street.
